faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about Bailo.
faq.contact.title: Didn't find your answer?
faq.contact.subtitle: Our support team is available to help you.
faq.a1: Bailo is a Belgian platform that allows landlords and tenants to rate each other. The goal is to create a trust history to secure rentals.
faq.a2: Profile creation and viewing basic reviews are free. Premium features may be offered.
faq.a3: Yes, Bailo covers all of Belgium: Wallonia, Flanders and Brussels.
faq.q4: Can I see a landlord's reviews before renting?
faq.a4: Yes, that's the principle of Bailo. You can view reviews left by former tenants.
faq.q5: How can I rate my landlord?
faq.a5: After your rental period, you can leave a review on several criteria: property condition, responsiveness, commitment compliance, communication.
faq.q6: What if I receive an unjustified bad review?
faq.a6: You have the right to respond. You can contest a review if it is false or defamatory.
faq.a7: Yes, Bailo complies with GDPR. Your data is never shared without your consent.
faq.q8: How can I verify a potential tenant?
faq.a8: Search for the candidate's profile on Bailo to see their rental history and reviews from former landlords.
faq.q9: Can I refuse a tenant because of a bad rating?
faq.a9: Bailo provides information, but the decision is yours. We encourage you to consider the entire profile and dialogue with the candidate.
faq.q10: How to rate a tenant after they leave?
faq.a10: Log into your account and leave a review on objective criteria: rent payment, property maintenance, neighborhood respect, communication.
faq.a11: No, Bailo is a complementary tool. Rental guarantees and insurance are still recommended.
faq.a12: Only verified users can leave reviews. We verify that the rental relationship actually existed.
faq.q13: What to do in case of abuse?
faq.a13: Report the abusive review. Our moderation team examines each report.
faq.a14: No. Bailo is a balanced reputation system, not a blacklist. Both parties are rated, and everyone can improve their score over time.
